quoteFirst: In the darkness, the infrared IRIS measured the night-side temperatures of the planet, and long-exposure images were taken to search for aurora, lightning, and fireballs in the Jovian atmosphere. At 10:20 a.m., Voyager reappeared from behind Jupiter and radio contact was restored; at
quoteLast: , it emerged from shadow into sunlight, speeding on toward encounter with Ganymede.
title: Voyage to Jupiter
author: Morrison, David, 1940-; Samz, Jane

quoteLast: : Fired stern tube at _Dal Alfven_. _Wale_ was 100 yards on our beam. Torpedo ran well and vessel sank in two minutes."
title: The Story of Our Submarines
author: Bower, John Graham, 1886-1940

quoteFirst: As he and the earth are getting farther apart, his diameter (apparently) diminishes from 10″ to 8″. He rises on the 1st, 15th and 30th at 12:27 p. m., 11:54 a. m., and
quoteLast: , and sets on the 2d, 16th, and May 1st at 3:09, 2:22, and 1:38 a. m., respectively. On the 4th, at 10:26 a. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, April 1884, No. 7
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteFirst: THE PRESIDENT SIGNED THIS RESOLUTION at
quoteLast: on the 20th of April, 1898. The Spanish Minister, Señor Luis Polo y Bernarbe, was served with a copy, upon which he asked for his passports, and "immediately left Washington.
title: History of Negro Soldiers in the Spanish-American War, and Other Items of Interest
author: Johnson, Edward A. (Edward Austin), 1860-1944
